__TOC__

Wow, so the first buglist at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuBugDay/20080425 just wasn't enough and you're ready to do more.  Here is a continuation list of bugs to work on.

=== Stock Replies ===
A stock reply you may want to use when closing 2.6.17 kernel bugs is:
<pre>
The 18 month support period for Edgy Eft 6.10 has reached it's end of life.  As a result, we are closing the linux-source-2.6.17 Edgy Eft kernel task.  However, please note that this report will remain open against the actively developed kernel.  Thank you for your continued support and help as we debug this issue.
</pre>

A stock reply you may want to use when asking a reporter to test with Hardy is:
<pre>
Hardy Heron 8.04 was recently released.  It would be helpful if you could test the new release and verify if this is still an issue - http://www.ubuntu.com/testing .  You should be able to test your bug using the LiveCD.  Please let us know your results.  Thanks.
</pre>

=== linux-source-2.6.17 Confirmed Bugs ===
Here is a list of bugs that should be considered for migration to the Hardy Heron 2.6.24 kernel.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
# Add the Hardy kernel "linux" task to the bug report if it hasn't already been added.  This can be done by clicking on the "Also affects distribution" link in the Actions area on left hand side of the bug report.  Select '''Ubuntu''' as the Distribution and type in '''linux''' for the Source Package Name.
# If the bug has not been tested against the Hardy release, please ask the bug reporter(s) to test against Hardy and report back their results (see stock reply above). Set the Hardy kernel "linux" task Status to "Incomplete" and subscribe yourself to the bug.
# If there are comments confirming the issue exists in the Hardy Heron 8.04 release, make sure the appropriate <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/KernelTeamBugPolicies|kernel debugging information]]</nowiki> has been provided for the Hardy kernel.  If it has, set the "linux" task Status to "Confirmed".  Otherwise, ask for the appropriate debugging information and set the 'linux' task Status to "Incomplete" and subscribe yourself to the bug.
# Close the "linux-source-2.6.17" task with a Status of "Won't Fix" (see stock reply above).  
** If you do not have the ability to set the "Won't Fix" status, tag the bug as '''edgy-close''' or ask someone in #ubuntu-bugs to help you mark it as "Won't Fix"

=== linux-source-2.6.17 Incomplete Bugs ===
'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Set the status to "Invalid" if the reporter had not responded and there is no way anyone could work on the bug.  
** Please be sure to leave a comment that if they are able to test the bug against the latest Hardy Heron 8.04 release and verify it is still an issue, reopen the bug against the "linux" package.  This can be done by clicking on the "Also affects distribution" link in the Actions area on left hand side of the bug report, select '''Ubuntu''' as the Distribution and type in '''linux''' for the Source Package Name.
'''OR'''
* If the reporter has responded but has not confirmed the issue against Hardy:
## Add the "linux" task
## Ask them to test against Hardy
## Set the "linux" task Status to Incomplete
## Subscribe yourself to the bug.
## Set the 2.6.17 Status to "Won't Fix" or tag the report as '''edgy-close''' if you are unable to set the Status.  You can also ask someone in #ubuntu-bugs to help you mark it as "Won't Fix"
'''OR'''
* If the reporter has confirmed the issue against Hardy
## Add the "linux" task if it hasn't already been added
## Make sure the appropriate <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/KernelTeamBugPolicies|kernel debugging information]]</nowiki> is present.
** If the information is present, set the "linux" task Status to Confirmed.
** Otherwise request they add the appropriate <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/KernelTeamBugPolicies|kernel debugging information]]</nowiki>, set the "linux" task Status to "Incomplete", and subscribe yourself to the bug report.
  1. Set the 2.6.17 Status to "Won't Fix" or tag the report as '''edgy-close''' if you are unable to set the Status.  You can also ask someone in #ubuntu-bugs to help you mark it as "Won't Fix"
